summary: REQ-1/2/3 appear implemented: a per-user backend preference `showResidentProfileReport` was added with migration defaulting to true; a Settings page toggle was added and wired to save/load the caller profile; and the Resident Profile page uses the preference to conditionally show report-related UI. However, several unrelated UI/boot/CSS changes were introduced that were not requested by the BuildRequest.

hallucinated_features.description: Global UI surface/background and print-related styling changes (e.g., `dialog-solid-white` utility and enforcing Radix dialog/popover/dropdown/select content surfaces to be opaque).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asked to add a settings toggle to conditionally hide/show the Resident Profile Report; it explicitly states non-goals include not redesigning or changing layout/content beyond conditional hiding. These CSS changes affect many dialogs/components beyond the requested feature.

hallucinated_features.description: Significant App boot/connection state machine changes with retry logic and toast notifications for backend connection attempts.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any requirement; unrelated to adding a settings toggle for the Resident Profile Report.

hallucinated_features.description: Resident dashboard and resident modals enhancements (e.g., Code Status badges/fields, medication modal PRN behavior, various modal layout/background changes).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; unrelated to the settings toggle feature and potentially violates the spirit of keeping changes scoped to the requested behavior.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (ResidentDashboardPage.tsx, AddNewResidentModal.tsx, EditResidentInformationModal.tsx, AddMedicationModal.tsx, RecordDailyVitalsModal.tsx summaries)

hallucinated_features.description: Added navigation header Settings icon/button in the global AppShell.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 requires a Settings UI reachable in the app, but it does not require a new header icon/button specifically; this is additional navigation UI not explicitly requested.
